Reviews.Title: “Good for Business”
Reviews.Author: rodzoz
Reviews.Content: We visit Rome fairly frequently to attend conferences and we need a good base to work from. The Domidea Hotel is clean, friendly, has free Internet and a good breakfast. We recently spend four nights here and will return when we need to visit Rome. This hotel is best if you have a car. It is located in an industrial area just of the A24. If this is your first visit to Rome and you are looking for a hotel to just explore the city from, this is not the one for you. However if you have a rented car to get to the hotel and don't mind taking public transport to visit the city it works great. The 437 bus stop is just a 1 minute or less walk. From there take the bus to the Ribibbia Metro station. You can buy tickets on the bus that are combined metro/bus tickets for €1 at the time of this review. That will get you into the city. Buy your ticket on the bus, validate it and keep it with you for entry to the metro. Buy another to come back out to the hotel. Of course, the hotel also provides a shuttle service to and from the Metro station in the AM up to 1030 and in the evening starting around 1730. Check with the hotel and also make reservations on the shuttle bus. Take a business card from the hotel as you will need to call them on your return to say you would like to use the shuttle back to hotel. (Or just catch the bus again.) All up the trip takes about 20-30 minutes each way. The rooms are clean and new. There is a huge bus depot near the hotel so if you are a light sleeper you may find the idling busses a slight annoyance, but in reality we didn't. We were there during the recent cold snap in Italy and the heating worked wonderful. I would expect the AC would too but as yet have not been there during the summer. Breakfast is served downstairs and has a good collection of breads (toast) cakes, ham, cheeses, coffee, juice, yoghurt, ceral and sweet cakes. Quite sufficient to get the day going. Next door you will find a nice restaurant, a small supermarket, a coffee shop and a pizza bar. All very convenient. It has good access from the GDR (Ring Road) and the A1. The Internet works well with both wireless and Ethernet. (cable not supplied)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel outside Rome”
Reviews.Author: thanasis342
Reviews.Content: The hotel has big rooms with enough facilities. The fourbeds room has two separate rooms, two tv, big refrigerator but nothing to make coffee or tea. Between 10 - 17 o'clock there is nowhere in the hotel to drink coffee because the bar is opening only after 5 o' clock in the afternoon. Breakfast was average and had only slices of white bread. The staff was friendly. Very close to the hotel there is a shop for sandwitches, coffees and restaurant. Close to the hotel there is a very good restaurant for stakes, La Pampa. Hotel disadvantage is that very close to it there is a big garage for busses that causes noise and dirty air full of gas. The metro station Rebibia is 5,2 km and you can visit everything in Rome by it. In half an hour you are in the central metro station, Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, Rude Staff, Too Far From Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michele M
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 3 in a family room which was huge. This was nice because my husband and I had our own private room. Nice large balcony. Free wi-fi worked great. The room appeared very clean, however, my daughter's white socks were completely black after walking around the room. The hotel was too far from Rome. It might be better if you have a car but we didn't. We spent about an hour each way to get into Rome. I hated wasting at least 2 hours per day in travel. On a final note, the manager was extremely rude to us. Upon check-in, we were told that our breakfast was included and given the hours and location, etc. I did not pay attention when booking the hotel as to whether is was or was not. Breakfast is a non-factor when booking a hotel for me. When we went to the breakfast room, we were told that it wasn't included. I mentioned that the person that checked us in the previous day indicated that it was. She then disappeared and came back with the manager. I explained to the manager what we were told at check-in. She pulled our reservation and told me that I should have known what reservation I had made (I didn't) and that there was no way the staff told me that our breakfast was included. She called me a liar in front of several groups of guests. I'm not upset about the breakfast issue, we went next door and had 3 caffes and 3 pastries for 6 euro, not a big deal. The issue was that I was called a liar and treated very rudly. For this reason alone, I would never return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, bad location”
Reviews.Author: AliAnne84
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great sized room and bath, and the price was great, but the location was a little too far from Rome. We had rented a car so it was about 20 min downtown. Parking is not as bad as you would imagine because Romans seem to make up their own parking spots! Overall, we liked it and the staff was nice. Do it if you have a car but don't if you plan to take a bus or train. Also the bed was a little stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, we didnt mind the 30 minute drive (and 20 min train) to the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: shon s
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel in our van, and the receptionist was more than welcoming, and he guided our van to the underground parking, next to the hotel and helped us to our rooms. The hotel was very comfortable, with three separate rooms, with one double bed, two singles, and a medium sized bathroom. The rooms were all very good sized and they all had TV. We also had air conditioning in each room, which wasn't broken, and was very cooling after the heat of the van. We went to sleep in comfort. Breakfast the next day was very nice with a fine selection of cakes, bread, croissants and also beverages. We had a very good breakfast. As we had a van, we didnt mind the 30 min drive to the centre of Rome, which wasnt very long. Unfortunately we had to go by train, so it took 50 mins to get to the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “New and nice hotel with basic facilities a bit far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: hasler13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights. This is a new large hotel in Rome suburb. Metro B from city centre to Rebibbia station takes around 15min and bus 437 or 447 another 10 minutes (bus operates every 15-20 minutes) to hotel. Bus stop is just around hotel. Hotel room was large, TV only in italian, large bed, A/C, fridge and a lots of storage in room. Bathroom is also large. Hotel provides shuttle transfer to Metro, but limited places and limited time because it is better to book it in the morning for next day. We didnt have breakfast, but there is a cafe around a corner and also a shop where you can buy stuff for your sandwitches for all day city trip. Hotel has no facilieties like restaurant (there is ristorante at the same place as cafe), pool, meeting room and so in my opinion this is not 4star hotel. Mornings at room were a bit noisy, it was some sound effect from corridors and neighbored rooms. Bad thinks about hotel: distance from city Good thinks about hotel: price, hotel is new, great room service This hotel is a great heaven for your all day trips to city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but a little far from Rome”
Reviews.Author: Georgios_H
Reviews.Content: I was impressed frrom the value of money that this gotel offers. Very nice and spacious rooms, relatively good (but not impressive) breakfast, good bathroom & overall facilities and free WI-Fi internet with a passcode that you can take for free from the reception. The staff is very pleasant and willing to assist you in any way. The only disadvantage is the distance from city, though the small minivan that the hotel operates somehow mitigates this inefficiency.. Last but not least the price I paid (Corporate) was very competi

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but far from city”
Reviews.Author: npires
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything you would look on a good hotel. Clean, good service, modern, plenty of space in the rooms, great price. The only issue, it's located in an industrial area outside the city and you would take almost 1 hour to get to the center. Still, they provide a shuttle to the nearest subway station until 10:30h. Still, for the price hardly you'll get any better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel but quite far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Cats_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Even the hotel is located in the industrial area far from the city center and not close to the nearest metro station (Rebibbia), I would recommend it to other travellers in Roma because of the added value you'll receive there. Free Wi-Fi in the room, free shuttle from the hotel to the nearest metro station and clean, comfortable and well equipped room is worth to be chosen in this very good 4 star hotel even if you travell without car in Rome. Good value for money in the capital city of Italy. You don't need to buy relatively expensive breakfast in the hotel, because just near of the hotel you'll find good supermarket and to buy all what you need.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IF YOU ARE DRIVING”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: My main criteria for a hotel in Rome was parking which may not be the way to pick a hotel but given the fact that I was driving was fairly high up on my list of criteria and this hotel fulfilled that criteria and more. The location of the hotel is out of central Rome, about 10 kilometres from the Vatican in an area that from what I saw in my four days there has absolutely nothing of interest to the average tourist, surrounded by small factories, offices and not much else and definitely not a place for a leisurely evening walk. This hotel appears to be mainly aimed at business people needing to be in this particular part of Rome for business reasons and not so much for tourists expecting to walk out and find everything Rome has to offer within walking distance. The hotel offers a free scheduled shuttle to a nearby subway station, Rebibbia in the mornings and when you come back you just call the hotel and they will send the van to the station to get you and take you back to the hotel up to either 10 or 11pm i think it was. What the hotel does have is really nice rooms at a good price, I paid $86 Australian dollars per night room only. My room 311, overlooked an inner courtyard which made the room very quiet and was by far the largest room I had on my entire two month trip in Europe. The room had a large king size bed, LCD TV, fridge, safe, good free internet access, air conditioning, desk, good wardrobe space, separate dressing area and a nice bathroom. This hotel appears to be mainly aimed at business people needing to be in this particular part of Rome for business reasons and not so much for tourists expecting to walk out and find everything Rome has to offer within walking distance. This hotel lacks any character but is a good choice if you are driving and need parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nomro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Domidea hotel with couple of friends in a triple room for 2 nights. The hotel is very nice, modern and new . We chose that hotel because it seemed to be the best hotel 4* in that price range. And it turned to be one of the best choices we made on our trip , if it is not the best. It also has its own free parking space, which is a blessing as we rented a car for our road trip Rome-PISA-Florence-Venice-Milan. The hotel is located in an industrial area , it is 1 minute driving off the small ring road around Rome, 20 - 30 mins drive to the city center depending on the traffic . I would recommend that you rent a car if you stay at that hotel , however I saw in other reviews that there was a shuttle bus that would take you to the nearest train station. I believe there was a cafe/ restaurant and a supermarket nearby (I did not use any of these) as I just used the hotel to sleep and shower while spent most of the time in the city center. The triple room was spacious with 2 LCD TV's , modern furniture and nice bathroom . The room was cleaned daily and was very well organized , although we left it a mess each day. (3 guys in 1 room could be a challenge for any hotel housekeeping :-) ) We had a very quick check in and they asked us at the front desk to fill in a small paper that they provided to us each day with what we'd like to have in our breakfast and when would we like to have it . We left that paper hanging outside on the door knob(similar to the do nit disturb sign). Then at the time we specified , someone knocks on the door with the tray of breakfast which was nice thing to do since they have a small dinning area. The breakfast was good with a lot of options. Bottom Line : I would definitely stay at that hotel again if I get to visit Rome one more time. I would recommend that you have a rented car as it is a bit far from the city center (shuttle bus available also to the nearest train station). The hotel is new, modern, cheap and very well kept . The service is good , with free parking . I wouldn't need anything else from a hotel in trip like that :) So go for it and please don't listen to the negative reviews (except for the distance from city center if it really bothers you!)

Reviews.Title: “Far Far Far!”
Reviews.Author: tatimiss
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews before booking about this hotel being far from the city center but I was lured in by the great price and the Hotels.com distance showing 2.2 miles from city center. The taxi stand outside of the train station had no idea where the hotel was and had to use a map. It was a 40 minute drive and $50 cab fare to get there. The hotel is in an industrial neighborhood with nothing to do nearby. The hotel was clean and modern but the bar was closed the whole time, the breakfast was $20 euros per person and the A/C would not go above 85 degrees F. We stayed one night and then got back to town the next morning. Which cost another $50 eruos, so the "great price" was a wash.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except service and location”
Reviews.Author: glober75
Reviews.Content: Positive points: New hotel with modern rooms. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated although just suffitiently spacy. We have found a very good rate for our 6-day stay (about 58 Euros per night without breakfast). There is a complimentary mini bus that can take you to the nearest metro station which is about 10 minutes away. Negative points: The hotel is too far away from city center. It takes 10 minutes from the hotel to Rebbibia metro station and 30 more to the center. This is very inconvenient if, for example, you plan to go out in the night for a drink when the metro stops. We had to rent a bike and with this means we were at the city center in 20 minutes. The personel is not helpful and almost unprofessional. For example at about 8 in the evening a glasss broke in our room. When we went to the reception and asked for a room maid to clean up the glasses from the floor the response from the two staff members in the reception was that there were no room maid on duty until next morning and we were handed over a piece of paper (!) so that we would clean the glasses from the floor by our shelves. In other occassions when we have asked either for information or assistance the personel was kind but totally unhelpful. The breakfast room is small and if many guests arrive for breakfast they will have to wait until the previous ones finish. No gym or pool Overall I would had reccaomended this hotel as a good value for the money I have paid IF the personel had been more proffessional.

Reviews.Title: “The best value you could get in Rome :)!”
Reviews.Author: DhannyaPrakash
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. My husband, my 4yr old and I were very comfortable during our 3 day stay here. The only problem you might face would be the location which is around 30minutes away from the city centre. We didn't find that to be too much of a problem since we used the shuttle service provided by the hotel to get to the metro station which is around 10minutes away (Rebbidea Line B - and that takes you all the way to the centre in around 20-25minutes). Theres also a bus stop at the corner of the hotel with buses at a frequency of 15-20 minutes. For breakfast or any meal theres a 24hr cafe just adjacent to the bus stop... so chances are you'll never go hungry :)! The rooms were larger than most italian hotel rooms, cleaned every day, the staff was very accommodating and friendly and English speaking.. which for us non-European language speakers (except English i.e) was a real blessing!!! All in all if you don't mind using public transport to and from this Hotel, this is a fantastic deal :)!! Oh theres also a supermarket near the cafe... just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those with a car, or tight budgets wanting a little extra.”
Reviews.Author: Layoo
Reviews.Content: Well the title summed it up really..... Good: The hotel has parking, although limited, you can park anywhere onsite if not blocking other vehicles....ie.right at the front. It's only a 10 min drive to the centre, or you can simply use the free courtesy bus that will drop you off at the bus station and then it's a 15 min ride into Rome. The rooms are ultra modern, the bed is good, the bathroom is excellent, towels are of good quality, toileteries are provided and the room is cleaned daily. There are plenty of English channels and Wifi is free. Bad: No real bad points especially for the price.....my only point would be that the hotel is aimed at business people only....meaning that for the average guest, there is nothing more than a nice room and parking......I guess this is reflected in the price, though the room more than makes up for this in quality. Summary: So if this is going to be your base for Rome you really can't do any better for the price as a similar hotel in central Rome will set you back at least three times the money. If you have a car, are a couple looking for something very nice but don't want to pay £200 per night....book this place and you'll be pleased. Tip: For those of you with a car......Lidl: Drive down Via Raffaele Costi as if going to join the A24 for Rome, but don't turn left at the "end" of the road, just follow the road to the right. Lidl is no more than 1 min on the left, or 2 mins from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for tourists with a car”
Reviews.Author: lhallowes
Reviews.Content: We looked at leaving our car in airport parking and trying to get a more central hotel without parking, but in the end we decided on this one which is further out but has free parking. It is not super close to a metro station but the hotel provides a shuttle and on one of the days we were there we drove to the station and left our car there for the day. They got our room made up immediately when we turned up early and asked to check in and the staff were very friendly. Room was excellent

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, a little far away.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_OE_09
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel. However the shuttle is not frequent enough and if you choose to walk back to the hotel you take your life in your hands with no sidewalks. There is a supermarket next door which is handy and a fridge in the room. The staff are not really very friendly but that is made up for with the sparkling clean rooms. The only bad thing that happened while we were there is that they called us in our room at about 9pm and asked if they could come up and fix something in half an hour. 1 1/2 hours later we called them to ask them why they had not come up and they now said they were just going to do it tomorrow, so we had been sitting up waiting for them to come so we could go to sleep. Other then that its a nice hotel, but quite hard to get to even with the shuttle.
